short_description: The function automatically determines the non-seasonal orders for univariate time series.
long_description: The function automatically determines the non-seasonal orders for univariate time series and whether there is a need to incorporate the drift and mean into the time series model, such as ARIMA or VARMAX.

input_tables.name: data
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input time series.
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the input time series.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the columns containing the response data.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the columns containing the response data.

argument_clauses.name: PartitionColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the partition columns that will be passed to the output. It must be specified when the function is not partition by 1. Otherwise, the result will be incorrect.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the partition columns that will be passed to the output. It must be specified when the function is not partition by 1. Otherwise, the result will be incorrect.

argument_clauses.name: TimeColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns that specify the sequence (time points).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns that specify the sequence (time points).

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
